channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: No historic museums were harmed in the making of this quiz. Can you score 11?
item.description: From brazen jewel heists to internet meltdowns, this week brought travesties galore.

item.title: Federal workers go without pay today. And, NBA stars arrested for illegal gambling
item.description: Today, millions of federal workers are missing their first full paycheck since the shutdown began. And, an NBA gambling scandal has led to the arrest ...

item.title: Boo to spooky chocolate prices! It's the year of chewy, fruity Halloween treats
item.description: Sales of non-chocolate candy are growing faster than those of chocolate. With cocoa in shortage, manufacturers are changing pack sizes, adding fillers...

item.title: Here's what experts say 'A House of Dynamite' gets wrong (and right) about nuclear war
item.description: Some praised realistic elements like the depiction of the White House situation room. But others said parts of the plot didn't ring true.

item.title: It's supposed to be payday for many federal workers. Instead, they're getting nothing
item.description: Roughly 1.4 million federal workers are going without pay due to the government shutdown. About half of them are furloughed, while the other half has ...

item.title: Ecuador's president says he was target of foiled chocolate and jam poisoning
item.description: Daniel Noboa claims three highly-concentrated toxic substances were found in gifts he was given.

item.title: Trump says trade talks with Canada 'terminated' over anti-tariffs advert
item.description: The US president says he is axing negotiations over an advert that used Ronald Reagan speaking negatively about tariffs.

item.title: Bears kill 1 person, injure 4 in Japan in record year for deadly attacks
item.description: Bears have been increasingly encroaching into Japan's towns due to factors ranging from a declining human population to climate change.

item.title: National Guard deployments in Washington, DC, and Portland, Oregon, are focus of court hearings
item.description: The deployment of National Guard troops on the streets of Washington faces challenges in two courts on Friday — one in the nation’s capital and anothe...

item.title: Police shoot at truck outside Coast Guard base during protests against Bay Area immigration crackdown
item.description: Officers opened fire Thursday evening at a vehicle backing into a line of police outside the U.S. Coast Guard base in Alameda.

item.title: Huge noise then I yelled to get out - Louvre attendant recalls shock of heist
item.description: The attendant describes the moment thieves used an angle grinder to burst into the Gallery of Apollo.

item.title: 'Mind-boggling' poker fraud used X-ray tables, high-tech glasses and NBA players
item.description: Prosecutors said the elaborate plot, which allegedly netted $7m from victims, belonged in a Hollywood film.

item.title: Slow-motion footage reveals secrets of snake bites
item.description: Scientists working out of a venom laboratory in Paris studied which snakes strike their prey fastest.

item.title: Trump says tech leaders and mayor changed his mind about using federal force in San Francisco
10/23: The Daily Report
item.description: Lindsey Reiser reports on two alleged gambling schemes involving NBA players and coaches, and a CBS exclusive sit-down with the Colombian president.

item.title: What is the price of gold today?
item.description: Understanding the pricing trends and dynamics of the gold market is crucial for making sound financial choices.

item.title: 9/19: CBS Morning News
item.description: Late-night hosts show support for Jimmy Kimmel after ABC pulls him off the air indefinitely; CDC committee recommends against combo MMRV vaccine for c...

item.title: As federal agents ramp up Chicago immigration crackdown, more elected officials caught in crosshairs
